meanings.definition: A person who is old-fashioned or resistant to change.
meanings.sent1: The mossbacks in our town prefer things the way they were in the past.
meanings.sent2: The community of mossbacks opposed the new technology.
meanings.sent3: The mossbacks at the meeting refused to consider any new ideas.
meanings.sent4: Her grandfather was a true mossback, never willing to try anything different.
meanings.sent5: The mossbacks' resistance to change was as solid as a rock.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are conservative or traditional in their beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The mossbacks in the village upheld the same customs for generations.
meanings.sent2: The political party was dominated by mossbacks who resisted any reforms.
meanings.sent3: The mossbacks in the club always insisted on following the same routines.
meanings.sent4: The mossbacks' traditions were as deep-rooted as ancient trees.
meanings.sent5: The mossbacks' beliefs were as unyielding as a mountain.

meanings.definition: A derogatory term for someone who is stubborn or set in their ways.
meanings.sent1: The boss called him a mossback for refusing to try the new method.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled a mossback for her unwillingness to adapt to change.
meanings.sent3: The kids jokingly called their teacher a mossback for always sticking to the rules.
meanings.sent4: Being a mossback in a fast-paced world can lead to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent5: His reputation as a mossback spread throughout the office like wildfire.
